business.headline: Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in first major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO sees Rs 3.2 lakh crore bids, GMP crosses 100%Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Before the public issue, Bajaj Housing Finance managed to raise Rs 1,758 crore from 104 anchor investors.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

Will Arvind Kejriwal get bail? Supreme Court verdict todayThe Supreme Court is set to deliver a crucial verdict on Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's petitions seeking bail and challenging his arrest by the CBI in the excise policy case.

Donald Trump says he will not debate Kamala Harris againIn a post on his social media platform, Truth Social, Trump asserted that Harris's request for another debate indicated she had lost their debate on Tuesday and was seeking a second chance to recover.

Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR, several roads waterlogged, more showers in storeThe weather department has issued an orange alert for Delhi-NCR, indicating a "be prepared" mode. The alert warns of potential disruptions to transport, including rail, road and air, with power outages also likely.

Ubtan and home remedies are great, but your skin needs advanced skincareFor a long time, our mothers and grandmothers relied on homemade, easy remedies to deal with skin problems. But are these natural remedies still effective for the skin today?

Lady Macbeth of Bengal: Governor vows to 'socially boycott' Mamata BanerjeeWest Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose on Thursday said he will not share any public platform with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, citing the public outcry over the Kolkata doctor's rape-murder.

Ex-Miss Switzerland finalist murdered by husband, body parts 'pureed' in a blenderKristina Joksimovic, a former Miss Switzerland finalist, was allegedly murdered by her husband, who dismembered her body. Victim's husband named Thomas, confessed to the killing, claiming self-defense.

With 1 billion followers, Ronaldo creates social media historyCristiano Ronaldo became the first individual athlete to surpass 1 billion followers across social media, solidifying his status as the most influential athlete globally, just days after reaching 900 career goals on the football field.

Ready to quit, says Mamata Banerjee as protesting doctors skip meetingMamata Banerjee's statement came after the doctors refused to hold a meeting with the government for the third straight day, demanding a larger delegation and a live-telecast of the meeting.

Elon Musk shares Haitian woman's video to back Trump's 'eating pets' claimThe post by Elon Musk comes as several media outlets are fact-checking claims made by Donald Trump that illegal immigrants from Haiti were eating pets in an Ohio city.

Ground report: In restless Manipur, displaced Kukis await return to normalcyManipur has borne witness to ethnic violence for the past 16 months. The victims of violence are spread across the valley and the hills, with thousands displaced from their homes. Here's a ground report from one displacement camp.

Row over PM visiting Chief Justice's homeSeveral opposition leaders and some lawyers expressed concerns over the PM's attendance at the puja at the Chief Justice's residence, viewing it as a potential breach of propriety. However, others dismissed these objections as unfounded and unnecessary.

Malaika Arora holds back tears as she leaves father's home with Arjun Kapoor, AmritaMalaika Arora was looking visibly emotional as she left her late father's home with sister Amrita Arora and Arjun Kapoor. Her father, Anil Mehta, died after jumping from their balcony.

Kamala Harris vs Donald Trump: Who is leading the polls?The two-day poll showed Kamala Harris with a five percentage point lead among registered voters, just above the four-point advantage she had over Donald Trump in an August 21-28 Reuters/Ipsos poll.

US company fires Indian-origin lawyer over relationship with CEONorfolk Southern Corporation dismissed Chief Legal Officer Nabanita Nag following an investigation into her consensual relationship with CEO Alan Shaw. Both were found to have violated company policies and the code of ethics.

sports.headline: AFG v NZ: Greater Noida rain forces 1st abandoned Test in 26 years, 8th in historyThe one-off Test match between Afghanistan and New Zealand became only the 8th Test match in cricketing history to be abandoned without any ball being bowled. Spain midfielder Gavi returns to Barcelona training after ACL injuryBarcelona midfielder Gavi has returned to training after being sidelined for nearly 10 months due to a torn ACL in his right knee. The 20-year-old sustained the injury while playing for Spain in a European Championship qualifier against Georgia late last year.
Manchester City hearing on alleged 115 breaches to begin on September 16: ReportsThe hearing into Manchester City's 115 alleged breaches is all set to begin on September 16, according to reports.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
